result.execSummary:
The defendant Leon Vaughn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Current sentence if revoked

**CORRECTED 8-28-2017: Extended Supervision on Count 1 is 1 year.**
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: Current sentence if revoked

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment if medically cleared.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No violent contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Request by Attorney Hargrove to adjourn the case off record. Attorney Hargrove is in trial in another branch and the defendant would not be present as a WRIT was not completed. No objection from ADA Zbikowski or Judge Mueller.

Defendant Leon Vaughn in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Defendant Leon Vaughn in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing at 01-14-2016 08:30 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, BLD (person, property, residence or family).   Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Leon Vaughn in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Leon Vaughn in custody.  Matthew J Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
